docs.lead_paragraph: My shelves are filled with parenting books. A good percentage of them are there because parenting is now my beat — new ones arrive in the mail every day and they are now piled everywhere. But my collection began long before Motherlode. Even before I was pregnant I figured that if I gathered enough of these volumes I would find the answers. Part of me still believes this, and an archaeologist could easily see what I was looking for over time by excavating down through the piles. “What to Expect When You’re Expecting,” “Your Baby and Child,” “Operating Instructions,” “Siblings Without Rivalry,” “The iConnected Parent,” “Parenting Your Adult Child.”
docs.abstract: Even better than parenting books is conversation about parenting books. Pull up a chair. I’ll bring the wine.
docs.snippet: Even better than parenting books is conversation about parenting books. Pull up a chair. I’ll bring the wine.

docs.lead_paragraph: Zenyatta, reigning Horse of the Year, is in foal to Bernardini and this time it looks as if it will take. The great race mare's first pregnancy ended prematurely. The news came via Zenyatta.com, her Web site, which is maintained by Dottie Ingordo-Shirreffs, the racing manager for Zenyatta's owners, Jerry and Ann Moss, as well as the wife of the mare's trainer, John Shirreffs.
